page.title: 02 CONSTANTINE LANDSCAPE 1
page.content: Constantine is about 100 metres above sea level.On either side of Constantine it has wooded valleys with streams leading to the Helford river. Valleys are covered with decidous trees .The village has views over the Lizard peninsula towards the sea.Much of the surrounding area is productive farm land growing vegetable crops.We can also see herds of milking cows in fields.Generally the area has so features than the North coast of Cornwall.There are many sheltered coves along the coastline of the Lizard area.The nearest beach to Constantine for swimming is Gunwalloe on the Lizard.Because we are near Culdrose R.N. airfield we a constantly overflown by helicopters. Constantine lies on granite strata but we have a fault line running under the Helford River valley.
